title: Slow Roasted BBQ Beef Roast Recipe
description: BBQ roast beef goes round and round on an outdoor rotisserie grill, coated in a mouthwatering blend of dried spices. Juicy, tender, and full of flavor!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Slow Roasted BBQ Beef Roast 4.5 (22) 16 Reviews 5 Photos This BBQ roast beef can be described in just three words: juicy, tender, and flavorful! Submitted by Warren Weber Updated on December 19, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 2 hrs Additional Time: 20 mins Total Time: 2 hrs 35 mins Servings: 10 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings 1 teaspoon Spanish paprika 1 teaspoon salt 1 teaspoon pepper ¼ teaspoon dried rosemary ¼ teaspoon dried thyme 5 pounds boneless rump roast 2 cloves garlic, sliced Directions Prepare an outdoor rotisserie grill for medium heat. Mix paprika, salt, pepper, rosemary, and thyme together in a small bowl. Cut slits on all sides of roast; insert garlic into slits. Rub spice mixture all over meat. Place roast on the preheated rotisserie and cook until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C), 2 to 5 hours. Let rest for 20 minutes before slicing. I Made It Print 63 home cooks made it! name: Warren Weber
instructions: Prepare an outdoor rotisserie grill for medium heat.;Mix paprika, salt, pepper, rosemary, and thyme together in a small bowl.;Cut slits on all sides of roast; insert garlic into slits. Rub spice mixture all over meat.;Place roast on the preheated rotisserie and cook until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C), 2 to 5 hours. Let rest for 20 minutes before slicing.
